Brian, Curran, Dean and all,

I had meant to write to Dean privately when I=
 read his original message the
other day, but got busy with the Thanksgivin=
g holiday.

Even though I am 'out of business' as a bookseller, I would be =
glad to help
out with identification, price suggestions, and any other assi=
stance I can
provide. In some cases I still may have "want lists" from clie=
nts who are
still looking for certain books, and I'm glad to do what I can =
to put
people and books together - that was the real thrill of bookselling.=


Dean, in most cases a photo of the cover will be enough for identificatio=
n,
though in some cases a shot of the colophon page with the publication
in=
formation will be needed where there are significant differences between
ed=
itions.

The email list(s) are decidedly not the best place to offer books =
like
these. I don't know what the subscriber counts are, but the nearly com=
plete
lack of traffic tells the story. The Nihonto Message Board is where t=
he
action and the collectors are, for the most part.

I did close my busine=
ss for health reasons, and my remaining Asia-related
stock is being handled=
 by Paragon Books, but I recently found a few
"stragglers" that I'll be off=
ering on NMB. I'm in the process of moving
over the next month or so to sma=
ller, rented, quarters, but I'm still alive
and interested and willing to h=
elp out wherever I can. I recently put
together a Hawley's offered there wi=
th someone I knew who had been looking
for a copy.

Dean or anyone can drop=
 me a line or call,

Craig
bridgeofdreams@...
847-846-7701 (cell)
